author: cmpilato
msg: Haha.  My last change was actually fine, but since I had the special
EOF text in the body of my log, and that text wasn't at the beginning
of a line, it trigger a different bug.  I'll put that text in this log
message right about "--This line, and those below, will be ignored--"
here and see if this new fix takes care of that problem.
(truncate_buffer_at_prefix): Don't give up the hunt for 'prefix'
just because the one you found didn't start in column 0.
There is magic text below this line that should get removed by my -F commit.

author: cmpilato
msg: (truncate_buffer_at_prefix): Work on const char * buffer now, return
void, and populate the new buffer's length.
and now also use that on log messages that come in via -m or -F.
I'm testing this by committing with -F.  Immediate below this
paragraph is the line "--This line, and those below, will be ignored--" and
the first verse of my latest song, "Bottom".  If you can see those
lyrics in this log message, I didn't actually fix the bug! :-)
--This line, and those below, will be ignored--
I'll head for the open door back home to you.
I'll head for the open door back home to you.
